page.title: 14HEALTH
page.content: Hope Clinic was built in 1964 to provide local health facilities for the community. These facilities include:- 1.Community Medical Officer: Responsible for the health development and immunisation of pre-school and school aged children. Also hearing and sight testing. 2.Community Dental Officer: Provides dental health education and dental treatment for pre-school and school aged children, expectant and nursing mothers and physically handicapped people. 3.General dental practitioner: providing dental treatment within the National Health Service. 4.Health Visitors: catering for the nursing and social needs of the community and working with the elderly.
